meanings.meaning_en_US: To be in opposition to something or someone.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 反對某事或某人

examples.sentence: His actions [go against] our values.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的行為違背了我們的價值觀。

examples.sentence: This proposal [goes against] the company's policy.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這項提案違反了公司的政策。

examples.sentence: They often [went against] the rules.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們經常違反規則。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To agree with or support someone or something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 同意或支持某人或某事

examples.sentence: I will [go along with] your decision.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我會支持你的決定。

examples.sentence: They [went along with] the plan despite their doubts.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 儘管有懷疑，他們仍然支持這一計劃。

examples.sentence: We should [go along with] each other’s ideas.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們應該支持彼此的想法。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To engage in a particular activity in various places or at different times.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在不同的地方或時間參與特定活動

examples.sentence: He often [goes around doing] community service.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他經常參與社區服務。

examples.sentence: They [went around doing] fundraising for the charity.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們四處募款以支持慈善事業。

examples.sentence: She is [going around doing] art workshops.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在各地舉辦藝術工作坊。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To attack or approach something with energy or enthusiasm.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 用精力或熱情攻擊或接近某事

examples.sentence: She [went at] the problem with determination.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她決心攻克這個問題。

examples.sentence: He [goes at] his studies with a lot of passion.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他對學習充滿熱情。

examples.sentence: They [are going at] the project with new ideas.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們正在用新想法推進這個項目。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To fail to keep a promise or commitment.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 未能遵守承諾或約定

examples.sentence: He was upset because she [went back on] her word.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他很不高興，因為她食言了。

examples.sentence: They [went back on] their agreement.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們違反了協議。

examples.sentence: You shouldn't [go back on] what you said yesterday.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你不應該反悔昨天所說的話。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become ill with something, especially a disease.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 感染某種病，尤其是疾病

examples.sentence: I [went down with] a cold last week.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我上週感冒了。

examples.sentence: He's [going down with] the flu.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他得了流感。

examples.sentence: Many students [went down with] a stomach bug.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 許多學生感染了腸道病毒。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To achieve a lot of success or progress.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 取得很多成功或進展

examples.sentence: If you work hard, you can [go far] in your career.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你努力工作，你可以在職業生涯中取得很大進展。

examples.sentence: She has [gone far] in her studies.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在學業上取得了相當大的進步。

examples.sentence: Many people believe he will [go far] in politics.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 許多人相信他在政治上將會有很大的成就。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To have no value or result; to do something without any reward.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 沒有價值或結果；做某事沒有任何回報

examples.sentence: All my hard work seems to [go for nothing].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我所有的努力似乎都沒有價值。

examples.sentence: If you don't continue, your efforts will [go for nothing].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你不繼續，你的努力就會白費。

examples.sentence: Efforts made without passion [go for nothing].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 沒有熱情所做的努力將毫無價值。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To attempt to achieve or obtain something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 試圖實現或獲得某物

examples.sentence: I think I will [go for something] adventurous on my vacation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我想我會在假期中選擇一些冒險的活動。

examples.sentence: She decided to [go for something] more challenging in her career.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她決定在職業生涯中追求更具挑戰性的事物。

examples.sentence: They are [going for something] great in their project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們在項目中追求偉大的成果。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To take part in or engage with something, usually as a habit or preference.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 參加或參與某事，通常作為一種習慣或偏好

examples.sentence: I really [go in for] cooking on the weekends.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我真的在週末喜歡烹飪。

examples.sentence: She [went in for] a lot of sports in high school.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在高中時期參與了很多運動。

examples.sentence: They [go in for] community events every month.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們每個月參與社區活動。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become very angry or uncontrollable.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 變得非常生氣或失去控制

examples.sentence: He [went mad] when he lost his wallet.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在丟失錢包時變得非常生氣。

examples.sentence: She’ll [go crazy] if this continues.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果這樣下去，她會瘋掉的。

examples.sentence: The noise made him [go mad].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 噪音讓他變得生氣。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To proceed to a different or new activity or subject.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 進行不同或新的活動或主題

examples.sentence: After finishing college, she [went on to] start her own business.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在大學畢業後開始了自己的事業。

examples.sentence: He [went on to] study abroad after high school.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他高中畢業後繼續在國外留學。

examples.sentence: They [go on to] discuss further plans after the meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們會在會議後討論進一步的計劃。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To continue having some activity with someone.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 繼續與某人保持某種活動

examples.sentence: I love to [go on swimming] with my friends.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我喜歡繼續與我的朋友遊泳。

examples.sentence: They plan to [go on hiking] this weekend.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們計劃這個周末繼續健行。

examples.sentence: We should [go on studying] together.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們應該繼續一起學習。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To complete or follow through with a plan or decision.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 完成或堅持執行一個計劃或決定

examples.sentence: He promised to [go through with] his commitments.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他承諾會堅持他的承諾。

examples.sentence: They must [go through with] the deal despite challenges.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 儘管面臨挑戰，他們必須堅持完成這項交易。

examples.sentence: She [went through with] the surgery as planned.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她按照計劃進行了手術。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To make a significant effort or take extreme measures to achieve something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 做出重大努力或採取極端措施以達成某事

examples.sentence: She was willing to [go to great lengths] to get the job.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她願意不遺餘力地獲取這份工作。

examples.sentence: They [went to great lengths] to organize the event.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們為組織這次活動付出了巨大努力。

examples.sentence: He [goes to great lengths] to ensure his family's safety.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他不遺餘力地確保家人的安全。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To exceed reasonable limits in behavior or action.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在行為或行動上超出合理的界限

examples.sentence: He really [went too far] with that joke.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的那個笑話真的過了火。

examples.sentence: If you [go too far], you might hurt someone’s feelings.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你過了頭，可能會傷到某人的感情。

examples.sentence: She tends to [go too far] when arguing.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在爭吵時往往會過火。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To manage in life without something, often due to necessity
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 因為必要性而在生活中沒有某事

examples.sentence: During the drought, many families had to [go without] water.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在乾旱期間，許多家庭不得不忍受缺水。

examples.sentence: He learned to [go without] luxuries.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他學會了過沒有奢侈品的生活。

examples.sentence: Sometimes you have to [go without] your favorite foods.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時你必須忍受不吃你喜歡的食物。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To distribute or pass something among a group of people.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在某群人中分發或傳遞某物

examples.sentence: Please [hand around] the snacks at the party.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請在派對上分發小吃。

examples.sentence: She [handed around] invitations for the event.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她分發了活動的邀請函。

examples.sentence: They will [hand around] flyers for the campaign.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們將為這次活動分發傳單。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be closely connected or in agreement.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 緊密相連或達成一致

examples.sentence: Innovation and progress go [hand in hand].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 創新與進步息息相關。

examples.sentence: Economic growth must go [hand in hand] with environmental protection.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 經濟增長必須與環境保護密切相關。

examples.sentence: They work [hand in hand] to achieve their goals.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們密切合作以實現目標。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To pass on knowledge or skills to someone else.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 將知識或技能傳授給其他人

examples.sentence: She hopes to [hand on] her skills to the next generation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她希望將自己的技能傳授給下一代。

examples.sentence: He [hands on] his wisdom to his students.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他將自己的智慧傳遞給學生。

examples.sentence: They [hand on] their traditions to their children.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們將傳統傳遞給孩子們。
